info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Rutherford and Polk Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Columbus, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Tryon, Mill Spring, Green Creek and Lake Adger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
